title: Daniel Chapter 12 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Daniel chapter 12 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Daniel Chapter 12 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Daniel Chapter 12.

questions.question: Who is described as the great prince standing for the children of Daniel's people?
options: Michael
Gabriel
Raphael
Uriel
questions.correctAnswer: Michael
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 states that Michael is the great prince which standeth for the children of Daniel's people.

questions.question: What will happen to many who sleep in the dust of the earth according to Daniel 12:2?
options: They shall awake to everlasting life or shame
They shall remain asleep forever
They shall be forgotten
They shall rise as angels
questions.correctAnswer: They shall awake to everlasting life or shame
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 says many who sleep in the dust shall awake, some to everlasting life, some to shame and everlasting contempt.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12:3, those who are wise will shine as what?
options: Brightness of the firmament
Stars in the sky
The sun
The moon
questions.correctAnswer: Brightness of the firmament
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 indicates that the wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament.

questions.question: What is Daniel instructed to do with the words and the book in Daniel 12:4?
options: Shut up the words and seal the book
Read the words aloud
Destroy the book
Share the book with all nations
questions.correctAnswer: Shut up the words and seal the book
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 commands Daniel to shut up the words and seal the book until the time of the end.

questions.question: Where were the two individuals standing that Daniel saw in Daniel 12:5?
options: On each side of the bank of the river
On the mountain tops
In the temple
In the city gates
questions.correctAnswer: On each side of the bank of the river
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:5 describes two standing on opposite sides of the river bank.

questions.question: Who is described as being clothed in linen and upon the waters of the river in Daniel 12:6?
options: The man clothed in linen
Michael the prince
Gabriel the messenger
Daniel himself
questions.correctAnswer: The man clothed in linen
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:6 refers to a man clothed in linen who is upon the waters of the river.

questions.question: How long shall it be until the end of the wonders according to the oath sworn in Daniel 12:7?
options: A time, times, and a half
Seven years
One thousand years
Forty days and nights
questions.correctAnswer: A time, times, and a half
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:7 states the duration as a time, times, and a half until the end of the wonders.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel understood the meaning of the words he heard about the end immediately.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:8 says he heard but did not understand and asked what the end would be.

questions.question: When are the words sealed until, according to Daniel 12:9?
options: Till the time of the end
Forever
Until the next generation
Until the temple is rebuilt
questions.correctAnswer: Till the time of the end
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:9 tells Daniel the words are sealed until the time of the end.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12:10, who will understand the words?
options: The wise
The wicked
Everyone
No one
questions.correctAnswer: The wise
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 explains that the wise shall understand while the wicked will not.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: From the time that the daily sacrifice shall be taken away, and the abomination that maketh desolate set up, there shall be ______ days.
options: one thousand two hundred and ninety
one thousand three hundred and five
seven hundred and fifty
one thousand
questions.correctAnswer: one thousand two hundred and ninety
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:11 specifies the period as one thousand two hundred and ninety days.

questions.question: Who is called blessed in Daniel 12:12?
options: He that waiteth and cometh to the thousand three hundred and five and thirty days
He that runs swiftly
He that conquers nations
He that builds the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He that waiteth and cometh to the thousand three hundred and five and thirty days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:12 blesses those who wait and reach the specified days.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel is told he will rest and stand in his lot at the end of the days.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:13 states Daniel will rest and stand in his lot at the end of the days.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel 12:4 says knowledge shall decrease in the time of the end.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 says knowledge shall be increased, not decreased, at the time of the end.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12:1, what will happen to the people found written in the book at the time of trouble?
options: They shall be delivered
They shall perish
They shall be forgotten
They shall be imprisoned
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be delivered
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 promises deliverance to those written in the book during the time of trouble.

medium.title: Daniel Chapter 12 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Daniel Chapter 12 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a time of intense trouble and asks you for encouragement. Based on Daniel 12:1, what biblical truth would you share about God's protection?
options: Michael, the great prince, stands for God's people and they will be delivered
God will remove all troubles immediately
Believers will never face any trouble
Only those who are perfect will be protected
questions.correctAnswer: Michael, the great prince, stands for God's people and they will be delivered
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 teaches that Michael stands up for God's people during unprecedented troubles and that those found written in the book will be delivered, showing God's faithful protection in trials.

questions.question: How does Daniel 12:2 encourage believers regarding death and eternal destiny?
options: Many who sleep in the dust will awake to everlasting life or shame and contempt
Death is the end with no further hope
Only a few will awake after death
Everyone will be judged immediately after death
questions.correctAnswer: Many who sleep in the dust will awake to everlasting life or shame and contempt
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 affirms the resurrection, promising that some will rise to everlasting life while others to shame, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness.

questions.question: A believer wants to live wisely and influence others. According to Daniel 12:3, what is the reward for wisdom and leading others to righteousness?
options: They will shine like stars forever
They will receive earthly wealth
They will be free from all troubles
They will be spared from judgment
questions.correctAnswer: They will shine like stars forever
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 promises that the wise and those who turn many to righteousness will shine like stars forever, encouraging godly wisdom and evangelism.

questions.question: How does Daniel 12:4 teach us about the value of knowledge and diligence in spiritual matters?
options: Knowledge will increase and many will run to and fro at the time of the end
Knowledge is unnecessary for faith
Only prophets will understand the end times
Running physically is a sign of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge will increase and many will run to and fro at the time of the end
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 encourages believers to seek understanding as knowledge grows, emphasizing spiritual diligence and study until the end.

questions.question: What does the sealed book in Daniel 12:9 symbolize for believers in waiting times?
options: Some truths are reserved for the time of the end
God hides all knowledge from believers
Believers should not seek understanding
The book will never be opened
questions.correctAnswer: Some truths are reserved for the time of the end
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:9 explains that the words are sealed until the time of the end, teaching patience and trust in God's timing for revelation.

questions.question: A believer faces temptation to give up during trials. Based on Daniel 12:10, what encouragement about perseverance and understanding can you share?
options: The wise will understand and be purified, but the wicked will continue in wickedness
Everyone will easily understand God's ways
Trials will end quickly for all
Wickedness will be rewarded
questions.correctAnswer: The wise will understand and be purified, but the wicked will continue in wickedness
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 teaches that perseverance leads to purification and understanding, encouraging believers to remain faithful despite opposition.

questions.question: How can Daniel 12:11-12 help believers maintain hope during periods of waiting and hardship?
options: Blessed is the one who waits and reaches the days mentioned, showing promise in endurance
Waiting is pointless and leads to despair
God will remove all waiting times
Only leaders will be blessed for waiting
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is the one who waits and reaches the days mentioned, showing promise in endurance
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:11-12 highlights blessings for those who patiently endure to the end, promoting hope and steadfastness.

questions.question: How does Daniel 12:13 encourage believers about the hope of resurrection and eternal reward?
options: After their rest, believers will stand in their lot at the end of days
Believers will face eternal punishment
All will perish without hope
The end is unknown and irrelevant
questions.correctAnswer: After their rest, believers will stand in their lot at the end of days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:13 promises rest and reward after life, encouraging faithfulness and contentment in God's plan.

questions.question: True or False: According to Daniel 12:3, leading others to righteousness has no lasting impact on a believer's reward.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 clearly states that those who turn many to righteousness will shine like stars forever, indicating a lasting reward.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel 12:10 teaches that the wicked will understand the end times just as the wise do.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 specifies that none of the wicked will understand, but the wise shall understand, emphasizing the importance of righteousness and wisdom.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Daniel 12:1 says, 'At that time shall ______ stand up, the great prince which standeth for the children of thy people.'
options: Michael
Gabriel
Raphael
Uriel
questions.correctAnswer: Michael
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 identifies Michael as the great prince standing for God's people during times of trouble.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by the increase of evil and wickedness. Based on Daniel 12:10, how should they view this reality?
options: The wicked will continue to do wickedly, but the wise will understand and be purified
Wickedness will eventually triumph over righteousness
God ignores the wickedness of the world
All will be purified equally
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked will continue to do wickedly, but the wise will understand and be purified
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 teaches that while wickedness persists, the wise gain understanding and purification, encouraging perseverance and hope.

questions.question: How does Daniel 12:4 inspire believers to grow spiritually and mentally during challenging times?
options: Knowledge will increase and many will seek understanding
Faith alone is enough without knowledge
Spiritual growth is irrelevant in trials
Only miracles can help believers
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge will increase and many will seek understanding
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 encourages the pursuit of knowledge and understanding, promoting spiritual growth and readiness for the end times.

questions.question: In Daniel 12:7, the man clothed in linen swears by the one who lives forever. What is the duration mentioned before the end of these wonders?
options: A time, times, and a half
Seven years
Ten days
One hundred years
questions.correctAnswer: A time, times, and a half
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:7 mentions this specific period symbolizing a set time until the scattering of the holy people's power is accomplished.

questions.question: What practical lesson about patience and hope can families learn from Daniel 12:12?
options: Blessed are those who wait and reach the designated days, teaching endurance
Waiting has no benefit
Only leaders should wait
God rewards impatience
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed are those who wait and reach the designated days, teaching endurance
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:12 encourages blessing for those who patiently wait, teaching families to cultivate endurance and faithfulness in daily life.

hard.title: Daniel Chapter 12 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Daniel Chapter 12.

questions.question: In Daniel 12:1, who is described as the great prince standing up for the children of Daniel's people?
options: Gabriel
Michael
Raphael
Uriel
questions.correctAnswer: Michael
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 explicitly states that Michael is the great prince who stands for the children of Daniel's people.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12:2, what will happen to those who 'sleep in the dust of the earth'?
options: They will remain in eternal sleep
They will awake to everlasting life or shame and everlasting contempt
They will be forgotten forever
They will return to dust without awakening
questions.correctAnswer: They will awake to everlasting life or shame and everlasting contempt
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 describes a resurrection where many will awaken, some to everlasting life and others to shame and everlasting contempt, indicating a final judgment.

questions.question: What imagery is used in Daniel 12:3 to describe the wise and those who lead many to righteousness?
options: They shall be like lions and eagles
They shall shine as the brightness of the firmament and stars forever
They shall be as mountains and rivers
They shall be like trees planted by water
questions.correctAnswer: They shall shine as the brightness of the firmament and stars forever
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 uses celestial imagery, describing the wise as shining like the brightness of the firmament and those who turn many to righteousness as stars forever.

questions.question: What does Daniel 12:4 instruct Daniel to do with the words and the book until the time of the end?
options: Share the words openly with all nations
Shut up the words and seal the book
Rewrite the words in another language
Destroy the book to prevent misunderstanding
questions.correctAnswer: Shut up the words and seal the book
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 commands Daniel to seal the words and the book until the time of the end, implying that the revelation was to be kept hidden until the appropriate time.

questions.question: In Daniel 12:7, the man clothed in linen swears by him that liveth forever that the time of the end will last how long?
options: A thousand years
A time, times, and a half
Seven years
Forty days and nights
questions.correctAnswer: A time, times, and a half
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:7 specifies the period as 'a time, times, and an half,' a prophetic expression often interpreted as three and a half years.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase ‘many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased’ in Daniel 12:4 in the context of biblical eschatology?
options: It predicts a decline in wisdom and travel
It foreshadows increased global exploration and technological advancement before the end
It refers to physical running as a metaphor for prayer
It symbolizes the spread of ancient languages
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows increased global exploration and technological advancement before the end
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4's mention of 'running to and fro' and increasing knowledge is often understood as a prophetic foreshadowing of the modern era's rapid travel and explosion of knowledge, relevant to eschatological timelines.

questions.question: True or False: According to Daniel 12:10, the wicked will understand the sealed words just as well as the wise.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 states that the wicked will not understand the words, but the wise shall understand, indicating a distinction in comprehension based on righteousness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Daniel 12:11: 'And from the time that the daily sacrifice shall be taken away, and the abomination that maketh desolate set up, there shall be ______ days.'
options: One thousand two hundred and ninety
Seven hundred
One thousand three hundred and five and thirty
Two thousand
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand two hundred and ninety
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:11 clearly states the period as 1290 days from the cessation of the daily sacrifice until the setting up of the abomination that causes desolation.

questions.question: What blessing is pronounced in Daniel 12:12, and what is the number of days associated with it?
options: Blessed is he who conquers; 1000 days
Blessed is he that waiteth and cometh to the 1335 days
Blessed is the wise; 1200 days
Blessed is the merciful; 1400 days
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is he that waiteth and cometh to the 1335 days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:12 pronounces a blessing on those who wait and reach the 1335 days, indicating a reward for perseverance through the tribulation period.

questions.question: In Daniel 12:13, what is Daniel told will happen to him until the end of the days?
options: He shall be taken to heaven
He shall rest and then stand in his lot at the end of the days
He shall live forever on earth
He shall forget the visions he received
questions.correctAnswer: He shall rest and then stand in his lot at the end of the days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:13 tells Daniel that he will rest (die) until the end of the days when he will stand in his allotted place, signifying resurrection and reward.

questions.question: The 'man clothed in linen' mentioned in Daniel 12:6 and 12:7 is a figure that parallels which of the following biblical figures or descriptions?
options: The High Priest in the Old Testament
The Son of Man in Daniel 7
The prophet Elijah
The angel Gabriel
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of Man in Daniel 7
questions.explanation: The 'man clothed in linen' on the waters of the river has parallels with the 'Son of Man' figure in Daniel 7, symbolizing a heavenly mediator or divine messenger.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Daniel 12:1-13 to frame the chapter's eschatological message?
options: Chiasm
Allegory
Parable
Hyperbole
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: Scholars identify a chiastic structure in Daniel 12 where themes of judgment, resurrection, and reward are framed symmetrically to emphasize the climax of prophetic revelation.

questions.question: How does the theme of resurrection in Daniel 12:2 connect with New Testament teachings?
options: It contradicts the New Testament's denial of resurrection
It foreshadows the resurrection of the dead as taught in 1 Corinthians 15
It only applies to Old Testament saints, not New Testament believers
It is unrelated to any New Testament doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the resurrection of the dead as taught in 1 Corinthians 15
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 anticipates a resurrection to everlasting life or contempt, a concept developed in the New Testament, particularly in 1 Corinthians 15 where the resurrection of the dead is central.

questions.question: What is the historical-cultural significance of the 'abomination that maketh desolate' mentioned in Daniel 12:11?
options: It refers to a pagan idol set up in the Jerusalem temple during the Maccabean period
It is a metaphor for the Babylonian exile
It symbolizes the destruction of the Tower of Babel
It denotes the Roman destruction of the Colosseum
questions.correctAnswer: It refers to a pagan idol set up in the Jerusalem temple during the Maccabean period
questions.explanation: The phrase 'abomination that maketh desolate' historically relates to the desecration of the Jewish temple by Antiochus IV Epiphanes during the Maccabean revolt, a key cultural backdrop to Daniel's prophecy.

questions.question: How does Daniel 12:10's distinction between the wicked and the wise reflect the theme of spiritual discernment in biblical literature?
options: It emphasizes that only the wicked will understand prophecy
It highlights that spiritual discernment is granted to the wise, enabling them to understand mysteries
It suggests that knowledge is equally distributed regardless of moral standing
It denies the existence of spiritual understanding
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights that spiritual discernment is granted to the wise, enabling them to understand mysteries
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 draws a clear distinction that the wise will understand while the wicked will not, underscoring a biblical theme where spiritual insight is a blessing granted to the righteous.

theological.title: Daniel Chapter 12 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Daniel Chapter 12 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who is described as standing up for the children of Daniel's people during a time of unprecedented trouble?
options: Michael, the great prince
Gabriel, the messenger
The Archangel Raphael
Jesus, the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: Michael, the great prince
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 identifies Michael as the great prince standing for the children of Daniel's people during a unique time of trouble. This aligns with other Scripture such as Jude 1:9 and Revelation 12:7, where Michael appears as a protector and leader in spiritual warfare.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12, what happens to those who 'sleep in the dust of the earth'?
options: Some awake to everlasting life, some to shame and everlasting contempt
They cease to exist
They reincarnate as new beings
They remain in eternal sleep until the end of time
questions.correctAnswer: Some awake to everlasting life, some to shame and everlasting contempt
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 teaches a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked, with differing eternal destinies. This is consistent with John 5:28-29 and Acts 24:15 which affirm resurrection and eternal judgment.

questions.question: What is promised to those who are wise and turn many to righteousness in Daniel 12?
options: They shall shine as the brightness of the firmament and as stars forever
They will receive earthly riches
They will rule over nations
They will be spared from all trouble
questions.correctAnswer: They shall shine as the brightness of the firmament and as stars forever
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 promises glory and eternal recognition for the wise and righteous influencers. This echoes Matthew 13:43 and Philippians 2:15 where believers are described as shining lights in the world.

questions.question: What instruction is given to Daniel regarding the words and the book until the time of the end?
options: Shut up the words and seal the book
Preach the words openly to all nations
Destroy the book after writing
Interpret the words for the kings immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Shut up the words and seal the book
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 commands Daniel to seal the prophecy until the end time. This concept of sealed prophecy is echoed in Revelation 5:1-5 where the scroll is sealed until the appointed time, highlighting God's sovereign timing.

questions.question: What is said about knowledge in Daniel 12:4 in relation to the time of the end?
options: Knowledge shall be increased
Knowledge will be lost
Only secret knowledge will remain
Knowledge will cause confusion
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge shall be increased
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:4 predicts an increase of knowledge in the last days, consistent with other prophetic Scriptures like Hosea 4:6 and 2 Timothy 3:7, which speak of knowledge and understanding in the eschatological context.

questions.question: What does the man clothed in linen do when he swears by Him who lives forever?
options: He holds up his right and left hands to heaven
He descends from heaven
He speaks softly to Daniel
He writes in the book of life
questions.correctAnswer: He holds up his right and left hands to heaven
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:7 describes the man clothed in linen raising both hands to heaven as a solemn oath by the eternal God, emphasizing God's unchanging and sovereign nature, as also seen in Hebrews 6:13-17 where God swears by Himself.

questions.question: How long is the period described by the man clothed in linen during which the holy people's power will be scattered?
options: A time, times, and a half
Seven years
One thousand two hundred and ninety days
Forty days and nights
questions.correctAnswer: A time, times, and a half
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:7 uses the apocalyptic phrase 'a time, times, and a half' indicating a period of persecution. This phrase parallels Revelation 12:14 and is traditionally understood as three and a half years, highlighting God's control over history.

questions.question: What is the response when Daniel asks about the end of these things?
options: Go thy way, for the words are closed up and sealed till the time of the end
You shall understand immediately
The end shall be revealed to all nations
Wait and the answer will come tomorrow
questions.correctAnswer: Go thy way, for the words are closed up and sealed till the time of the end
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:9 shows that the understanding of these prophecies is reserved for the end times, reflecting the principle found in 1 Corinthians 13:9-10 that partial knowledge will be done away with when perfection comes.

questions.question: According to Daniel 12, who will understand the words of the prophecy?
options: The wise shall understand, but none of the wicked will
Everyone will understand equally
Only the priests will understand
No one will understand until the resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: The wise shall understand, but none of the wicked will
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 states that the wise will comprehend the prophecy while the wicked will not, reflecting biblical teaching in Proverbs 1:5 and Matthew 13:11 about spiritual discernment granted by God to the wise.

questions.question: What event marks the beginning of the 1290 days mentioned in Daniel 12?
options: The daily sacrifice being taken away and the abomination that maketh desolate set up
The first trumpet sounding
The coming of the Messiah
The rebuilding of the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: The daily sacrifice being taken away and the abomination that maketh desolate set up
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:11 specifies the removal of the daily sacrifice and the setting up of the abomination of desolation as the starting point for the 1290 days, a timeline also referenced by Jesus in Matthew 24:15-21 regarding end time tribulation.

questions.question: Who is described as blessed in Daniel 12:12?
options: He that waiteth and cometh to the 1335 days
He that conquers in battle
He that gains great wealth
He that leaves the land of his birth
questions.correctAnswer: He that waiteth and cometh to the 1335 days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:12 pronounces blessing on those who patiently endure until the 1335 days, illustrating the biblical theme of perseverance found in James 1:12 and Revelation 14:12.

questions.question: What promise is given to Daniel about his own fate in Daniel 12:13?
options: He shall rest and stand in his lot at the end of the days
He shall reign with the Messiah
He shall be taken to heaven immediately
He shall be forgotten and his writings lost
questions.correctAnswer: He shall rest and stand in his lot at the end of the days
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:13 comforts Daniel with the assurance of rest (death) and resurrection to his appointed inheritance, echoing themes in Job 19:25-27 and John 11:25-26 regarding resurrection and eternal life.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the 'time of trouble' described in Daniel 12:1 and God's deliverance?
options: The time of trouble is unprecedented, but God's people will be delivered
The time of trouble will destroy all without exception
The time of trouble is a myth and will not come
God will abandon His people during the time of trouble
questions.correctAnswer: The time of trouble is unprecedented, but God's people will be delivered
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:1 presents a unique time of trouble but assures deliverance for those written in the book, consistent with God's faithfulness in Psalm 34:19 and Romans 8:28 to protect His people.

questions.question: What does Daniel 12 teach about the final judgment?
options: There will be a resurrection with everlasting life for some and everlasting contempt for others
All will be saved regardless of deeds
Judgment is symbolic and not literal
Only angels will be judged
questions.correctAnswer: There will be a resurrection with everlasting life for some and everlasting contempt for others
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:2 describes a resurrection and eternal destinies, harmonizing with Revelation 20:12-15 and John 5:28-29, affirming a final judgment by God based on righteousness.

questions.question: What does Daniel 12:10 say about the purification and trials of many?
options: Many shall be purified, made white, and tried
All shall be condemned without exception
Only the wicked will be tried
Purification will come through earthly wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Many shall be purified, made white, and tried
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:10 speaks of a refining process for many, which accords with biblical teachings on sanctification and testing in passages like 1 Peter 1:6-7 and Malachi 3:2-3.
